intro: Anarrhinum bellidifolium var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate bellidifolium anarrhinum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid landscapes. The plant is noted for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions, which contributes to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
